intro: Hutchinsia drepanensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hutchinsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a dense, spherical shape, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hutchinsia drepanensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand high salinity and drought conditions.
